text: The gladiator in the sand, where he has placed his fate, and has condemned him as a slave, salutes the Caesar who is in the ring, surrounded by stars. Salute from the front, without pride, for the slave cannot have it; without joy, for the condemned cannot rejoice. Heal so that the law does not fail those to whom the law fails. But after greeting, the cloak that will not serve him in battle is slung over his chest. If the defeated one dies, and the victor who kills, with this, confessing to be defeated, one is declared the victor. FIN
title: Otra lección
author: Fernando Pessoa
